intro: Strychnos minor var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved strychnos, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a distinctive, narrow shape. The species is part of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its toxic alkaloids, which are found in its seeds and other parts.
